moves.1. d4: Very tied game with uncommon situation and draw obtained by sacrifying a rook.
moves.4... cxd4: ... so that I opt to take
moves.6. e4: Another possibility was 6. Nxc6 bxc6, creating a semi open file in b for the black rook.
moves.6... Bb4: pinning the knight. Another option was to fiancheto the bishop by playing 6.g6
moves.7. f3: White weakens both sides in case of a castling but white has now a strong center
moves.8... d5: i do not want to let white fully control the center
moves.9. Nxc6: It seems a mistake, for it enables black to set a pawn on c6, thus reinforcing the central d pawn and it creates a semi open file on b.
moves.9... bxc6 10. e5: pushing on the center but the pawn will be hard to defend.
moves.12. Qc2: The queen can be dangerous, aiming on h7 and she protects c3
moves.12... Ba6: c5 would have been better, enabling d4
moves.13. O-O: King in safe but the opened a7 g1 diagonal is dangerous.
moves.13... Qc5+: ... and black has to seize the occasion.
moves.15. Rae1: White prefers to protect his bishop but I think trading (15. Bxc4 Qxc4) would have been better. Black's plan is now to get the b pawn on c3 so that white has 2 isolated pawns.
moves.15... Qd4: Attackin the unprotected f4 knight and preparing to trade.
moves.16. Bg3: only move if white doesn't want to lose the e pawn.
moves.17. bxc3: White has now 2 isolated pawns and one pawn less.
moves.17... Qc5: This is a bad place for the queen but the aim is to send it on a5.
moves.18... Bxe2: I didn't found anything better and black has got enough material and positional advance to afford trading.
moves.20. f5 Rab8: I choose not to take and to prepare my attack (plan : occupy the open file - done, double the rooks and set one on the first line), estimating that it will take at least 4 moves to white to build a dangerous attacking possibility against the black king and I'll get a mating menace in 3 moves if white doesn't defend.
moves.21. f6: I underestimated the danger of white's progression.
moves.21... g6 22. Qd2 Rfc8: I didn't see any other place for the rook but it's a weak move, letting the initiative to white. 22. Rb7 would have been better.
moves.23. h4: White is on attack on the kingside
moves.24. h5 Rcb8: Black lost one move by playing 22. Rc8
moves.25. hxg6: I saw little point in this move. The following trade doesn't seem to have much importance in this position. It weakens both kings. in fact I underestimated white's attack.
moves.26... Rb7b1+: It seemed to me the obvious move to play
moves.27. Kh2: White culd have interpose a piece but chooses to move the king.
moves.27... Qg1+: Harassing the white king but Dame Guenièvre is blocked far away from her king and husband.
moves.28... Rd1: To chase the queen from the c1 h6 diagonal
moves.29. Qc2: The white queen is less dangerous on this diagonal. But the 2 pieces on line 1 are cramped
moves.30. Bh2: ... but whites sees the danger and prevents it
moves.31. Rg4: Danger on g6 : if 32. Rxg6 ! fxg6 33. Qxg6+ Kf8 34. Qg7+ with mate to follow.
moves.32. Rxg6: Equalising material. Both kings are unsafe and material is equal but black has 2 pieces blocked in the corner.
moves.35. Qa4: Now white's attack is getting even more dangerous.
moves.36... Rh5+: I couldn't find any other idea.
moves.37. Rxh5: White is one rook ahead and the game seems to be lost for black
moves.37... Ng6: "My kingdom for a horse" The brave Perceval goes for a desperate ride to save the situation and obtain a draw.
moves.38. Qd6+ Kc8: Only move to prevent the mate (if 38. ... Ke8 39. Qe7+mate)
moves.39. Qxc6+: White carries on pressing the black king.
moves.40. Rh7: Menacing 41. Rxf7 ... 42. Qc7+ with mate to follow or 41. Rg7 ... 42. Rg8+ with mate to follow. Verrry dangerous but in both cases white needs 2 moves before setting Arthur in chess.
moves.40... Qb1: ... so that black has 2 moves available. Dame Guenièvre saves her husband for she menaces : 41. ... Nf4+ If 42. Kh4 Qxh7+, 43. ... Nxe2 it's white's turn to be in trouble. If 42. Kg3 Nxe2+ 43. ... Qxh7 and white is in late in material.
moves.41. Rf2: Black cannot be in advance of material if playing 41. ... Nf4
moves.41... Nf4+: ... But still plays it. Perceval lays down his life for his king without any hesitation.
moves.42... Qxh7+: Reducing the late in material and preparing a draw.
moves.43. Kg4 Qg6+: 43. ... Qxh2 was another possibility but I wasn't so sure it lead to a draw for white would regain the initiative.
moves.45. Kg4: If 45. Kf2 Rb2+ and the white king is doomed. White proposes the draw... Gladly accepted !
